etymologies: early 17th century: from French mousseline, from Italian mussolina, from Mussolo ‘Mosul’ (see Mosul, where it was first manufactured)

definitions: lightweight cotton cloth in a plain weave

examples.text: she folded the dress in layers of clean muslin

shortDefinitions: lightweight cotton cloth in plain weave

definitions: a hemmed square of lightweight cotton cloth used to wipe up regurgitated milk when feeding or burping a baby

examples.text: I'm surrounded by piles of nappies and muslins

shortDefinitions: cotton cloth used to wipe up milk regurgitated by baby
